author: The Linux Foundation
description:
Sponsored by: vCluster

Modern platform engineering requires more than just Kubernetes – it’s about building a cohesive ecosystem that supports developer autonomy and operational scalability. In this session, we’ll walk through how to build a self-service Kubernetes catalog using Helm, GitOps, and vCluster, while integrating CI pipelines and composable infrastructure tools like Terraform, Helm, Kro, Kratix, etc. Learn how to connect these components into a seamless platform experience that’s ready for real-world, day-2 operations.

Topics we’ll cover include:

- How can you build a Helm-based catalog that empowers teams to deploy services on their own?
- What does it mean to “compose” infrastructure using tools like Terraform, Kratix, and Score?
- How does label-based deployment work in Argo CD, especially across multiple vClusters?
- How can Go-based templates and CI pipelines generate deploy-ready manifests for GitOps?
- What does a fully integrated GitOps workflow look like from CI
title: LF Live Webinar: From CI to Kubernetes Catalog: A Practical Guide to vCluster and GitOps
